question: Frei's intradermal test is done for:
exp: Ans: b (LGV) Ref: Ananthanarayanan, 7th ed, p. 428. Frei's test was an intradermal test commonly used for LGVThe crude chlamydial antigen (from bubo pus)is inoculated intradermally in the forearm. An induration 7mm or more in 2-5 days is taken as positive test. Due to the frequentoccurance or false positive reactions, it is not used now. Other common tests frequently asked. question: Chlamydia is a:
exp: Ans: a (Bacteria) Ref: Ananthan7th ed, p. 422. Chlamydiae are obligate intracellular bacterial parasites of humans, animals and birds. Virus. Chlamydia* Obligate intracellular parasites* Obligate intracellular parasite* Contain only one type of nucleic acid either DNA or RNA* Possess both DNA and RNA* Lack enzymes for protein/ nucleic acid synthesis. Depends on synthetic machinery of host for replication* Multiply by complex process(not by binary fission)* Unaffected by antibacterial antibiotics.* Have cell wall and ribosomes* Multiply by binary fission* Susceptible to usual antibiotics. The disease caused by various chlamydia are as follows: Chlamydia trachomatis: 1. Serotype A, B. C2. Serotype D to K- Trachoma- Inclusion conjunctivitis. Genital chlamydiasis. Infant pneumonia3. Serotypes L1. L2. L3- Lymphogranuloma venerum. Chlamydia psittaci--causes psittacosis. Chlamydia pneumoniae--causes acute respiratory disease. Inclusion bodies in chlamydia: Halberstaedter Prowazek (HP bodies). Levinthal Cole Lillie (LCL bodies). Miyagawas granulo corpscles (elementary body)- C. trachomatis- C. psittaci- LGVHorders spots- a faint macular spot (like rose spots of typhoid fever) is seen in psittacosis. Mycoplasma: They are small free living bacteria (and not intracellular parasites). Obligate intracellular parasites do not grow in cell free medium but mycoplasma do. Organisms which do not grow on cell free media. Mycobacterium leprae. Chlamydia. Rickettsiaceae. Coxiella bumetti. Pathogenic treponemas. Viruses.
